description: System-wide voice dictation tool for Ubuntu using OpenAI Whisper API

userStories.title: Set up project structure
userStories.description:
Create Python project with virtual environment and proper directory structure.

**What to do:**
- Create Python virtual environment (venv)
- Set up directory structure: src/, config/, tests/, scripts/ralph/
- Create requirements.txt with initial dependencies: openai, pynput, sounddevice, pystray, pyperclip, plyer
- Configure .gitignore for Python projects (venv/, __pycache__, *.pyc, .env, *.log)
- Write basic README.md with setup instructions and project overview
acceptanceCriteria: Virtual environment created and can be activated with: source venv/bin/activate
Directory structure matches: src/, config/, tests/, scripts/ralph/
requirements.txt lists all needed dependencies
.gitignore excludes venv/, __pycache__, *.pyc, .env, *.log
README has clear setup instructions
No errors when running: python --version (should be 3.8+)
userStories.notes: This is the foundation - must complete first before any other stories

userStories.title: Record audio on keyboard shortcut
userStories.description:
Implement global keyboard listener and audio recording functionality.

**What to do:**
- Use pynput library to register global keyboard shortcut (Ctrl+Shift+Space)
- Use sounddevice library to capture audio from default microphone
- Implement toggle behavior: first press starts recording, second press stops
- Save recorded audio to temporary WAV file in /tmp/ directory
- Implement 240-second maximum duration with automatic stop
- Create src/recorder.py module with AudioRecorder class
- Create src/main.py as entry point

**Implementation notes:**
- WAV format, 16kHz sample rate, mono channel (compatible with Whisper)
- Use threading to avoid blocking the keyboard listener
- Store recording state (idle/recording) as class attribute
acceptanceCriteria: Global keyboard shortcut (Ctrl+Shift+Space) works across all applications
First press starts recording, second press stops recording
Audio saved as WAV file in /tmp/ directory
File format compatible with OpenAI Whisper API (16kHz, mono)
Maximum recording duration of 240 seconds enforced (auto-stop)
No errors when running: python -m src.main
Manual test: Press shortcut, speak for 5 seconds, press again, verify WAV file created in /tmp/
userStories.notes: Use pynput.keyboard.GlobalHotKeys for cross-platform global hotkey support

userStories.title: Transcribe audio using OpenAI Whisper API
userStories.description:
Integrate OpenAI Whisper API for speech-to-text transcription.

**What to do:**
- Install and configure openai Python SDK
- Create src/transcriber.py module with WhisperTranscriber class
- Read API key from config file at ~/.config/voice-ctrl/config.json
- Send audio file to OpenAI Whisper API endpoint (/v1/audio/transcriptions)
- Handle API responses and extract transcribed text
- Implement error handling for: network errors, invalid API key, file not found, API rate limits
- Clean up temporary audio file after transcription (success or failure)
- Log errors to ~/.config/voice-ctrl/voice-ctrl.log

**Implementation notes:**
- Use openai.Audio.transcribe() method
- Default to English language (can be auto-detected by Whisper)
- Set timeout to 30 seconds for API calls
acceptanceCriteria: Audio file successfully sent to OpenAI Whisper API
API key read from ~/.config/voice-ctrl/config.json
Transcribed text returned as string
Graceful error handling for: network issues, invalid API key, timeout
Temporary audio file deleted after transcription
Errors logged to ~/.config/voice-ctrl/voice-ctrl.log
Manual test: Create test WAV file, call transcribe(), verify text returned
userStories.notes: Requires valid OpenAI API key in config file for testing

userStories.title: Insert transcribed text automatically
userStories.description:
Auto-paste transcribed text at cursor position using clipboard.

**What to do:**
- Use pyperclip library to interact with system clipboard
- Copy transcribed text to clipboard
- Use pynput.keyboard.Controller to simulate Ctrl+V keystroke
- Implement paste functionality in src/paster.py module
- Optionally save and restore previous clipboard contents
- Ensure focus remains on the application where user was typing

**Implementation notes:**
- Wait 100ms between clipboard copy and Ctrl+V to ensure clipboard is ready
- Test with various applications: terminal, browser, text editor, LibreOffice
- Handle edge cases: empty transcription, very long text
acceptanceCriteria: Transcribed text copied to system clipboard
Ctrl+V keystroke simulated successfully
Text pasted in currently focused application
Works across different applications: terminal, Firefox, VS Code, gedit
Clipboard optionally restored to previous contents after paste
No errors when pasting text
Manual test: Run app, record speech, verify text appears at cursor in active window
userStories.notes: May need to handle clipboard access permissions on some Linux systems

userStories.title: Show system tray icon
userStories.description:
Display persistent system tray icon with status indicators.

**What to do:**
- Use pystray library to create system tray icon
- Create two icon states: idle (gray microphone) and recording (red microphone)
- Display appropriate icon based on recording state
- Show tooltip "Voice Control" when hovering over icon
- Create src/tray_icon.py module with TrayIcon class
- Icons can be simple PIL-generated images initially (or use icon files if available)
- Ensure icon is visible in Ubuntu system tray (GNOME Shell)

**Implementation notes:**
- Use pystray.Icon class
- Update icon in real-time when recording starts/stops
- Icon should persist until application is closed
acceptanceCriteria: System tray icon appears when application starts
Icon shows idle state by default (gray/white microphone icon)
Icon changes to recording state (red microphone) when recording
Icon visible in Ubuntu GNOME Shell system tray
Tooltip displays "Voice Control" on hover
Icon updates in real-time based on recording state
Manual test: Start app, verify icon in tray, start recording, verify icon changes color
userStories.notes: GNOME Shell may require TopIcons extension for tray icon support on some systems

userStories.title: Handle errors with notifications
userStories.description:
Display desktop notifications for errors and important events.

**What to do:**
- Use plyer library for cross-platform desktop notifications
- Create src/notifier.py module with Notifier class
- Show notifications for: transcription errors, API failures, network timeouts, invalid API key, no audio detected
- Each error type should have a specific, user-friendly message
- Log all errors to ~/.config/voice-ctrl/voice-ctrl.log with timestamp
- Ensure application continues running after non-fatal errors
- Create ~/.config/voice-ctrl/ directory if it doesn't exist

**Implementation notes:**
- Use plyer.notification.notify() with title and message
- Notification timeout: 5 seconds for errors
- Log format: [YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS] ERROR: message
acceptanceCriteria: Desktop notification shown for errors
Specific error messages for: no audio detected, API failure, network timeout, invalid API key
All errors logged to ~/.config/voice-ctrl/voice-ctrl.log
Log file created if it doesn't exist
Application continues running after non-fatal errors
Log entries include timestamp and error type
Manual test: Trigger error condition (e.g., invalid API key), verify notification appears and error logged
userStories.notes: Test notifications work on Ubuntu with GNOME desktop environment

userStories.title: Use Shift+Insert for pasting instead of Ctrl+V
userStories.description:
Change paste mechanism to use Shift+Insert for better command-line tool compatibility.

**What to do:**
- Modify src/paster.py to simulate Shift+Insert instead of Ctrl+V
- Update keyboard simulation to press Shift+Insert keys
- Test with various command-line tools: bash, zsh, vim, nano, tmux
- Test with GUI applications to ensure compatibility: Firefox, VS Code, gedit, LibreOffice

**Implementation notes:**
- Shift+Insert is the standard paste shortcut in terminals and most Linux applications
- Ctrl+V may be intercepted by terminal emulators for other functions
- Both shortcuts should work in most GUI applications, but Shift+Insert has better terminal support
acceptanceCriteria: Shift+Insert keystroke simulated instead of Ctrl+V
Text pastes successfully in terminal applications: bash, zsh, gnome-terminal
Text pastes successfully in terminal editors: vim, nano, emacs
Text pastes successfully in GUI applications: Firefox, VS Code, gedit
Works inside tmux and screen sessions
No regression in paste functionality
Manual test: Record speech and verify paste works in terminal, vim, and browser
userStories.notes: Shift+Insert is more universal across terminal and GUI applications on Linux
